ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: It was really really helpful to have this course to check in about how we were feeling about our thesis and have some collective accountability. I also learned some research tips which was helpful.

I learned from my peers, and the course instructor, different ways to approach writing my thesis, which has equipped me with time management and note-taking skills, as well as research abilities that I will use beyond this course.
This course helped guide the beginning of the my thesis and managing the various difficulties that arose.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths of the class was the peer-review we were able to get on our work throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would definitely recommend this course to another student!! It was very very helpful to have an earlier deadline to be forced to put more time into my thesis assignments and also have regular check-ins just to stay thinking about my thesis more regularly.
I would highly recommend this course to every HSHM major completing their thesis. It was an extraordinarily helpful resource to have.
